title: Implement FreeRTOS and refactor codebase to use multi-tasking
description: Refactor entire codebase to use FreeRTOS for multi-tasking architecture. Create separate tasks for WiFi management, sensor operations, control logic, and logging. Establish task queues for inter-task communication. This provides foundation for complex system with sensors, relays, logging, and OTA updates without blocking issues.
acceptance_criteria: WiFiManager refactored to run on dedicated FreeRTOS task
Task queues established for WiFi status communication
Main loop simplified to orchestration and OTA handling
No blocking operations in any task
Tested on device with stable operation

verification.test_results: Tested on device: FreeRTOS tasks running stably. WiFiManager on dedicated task executing handle() every 50ms. Main task running every 100ms with queue-based communication. Device stable with consistent free heap. All acceptance criteria met.
